subject: AI & Agents
title: Differential Privacy in Model Training
description: A short lesson to help you apply Differential Privacy in Model Training.

hook.text: Can you train on sensitive data without the model remembering any single person?

buildup.text: Differential privacy adds calibrated noise during training so no one record is detectable.

discovery.text: DP-SGD clips gradients and adds Gaussian noiseâ€”provable privacy guarantees per record.

twist.text: Strong privacy = more noise = lower accuracy. The privacy-utility tradeoff is real.

climax.text: Set your epsilon budget based on the sensitivity of the data and acceptable accuracy loss.

punchline.text: Privacy by math, not by hope.

quiz.question: What tradeoff does differential privacy introduce?
